title: Rear Window, Replace

steps.text: Remove rear clamshell - see operation “Rear Clamshell, Remove and Install”
Install Suction Lifter MKM-641 to engine side of rear window
Remove rear window from rear window aperture
Place rear window on suitable stand, then remove Suction Lifter MKM-641
Remove residual sealant from rear window aperture to approx. 1 mm thickness
Clean sealing surface of rear window aperture and new rear window
Apply activator to sealing surface of new rear window and sealing surface of rear window aperture
Apply primer to sealing surface of rear window and sealing surface of rear window aperture

substeps.text: Shake primer bottle thoroughly before applying

steps.text: Install Suction Lifter MKM-641 to engine compartment side of rear window
Apply sealant to sealing surface of rear window
Install rear window to rear window aperture

substeps.text: Apply gentle pressure to rear window to ensure correct sealing

steps.text: Remove Suction Lifter MKM-641 from rear window
Clean both sides of rear window
Install rear clamshell - see operation “Rear Clamshell, Remove and Install”
Allow vehicle to stand for 10 hours before moving.

warnings:
Primer should be left
to dry for 15 minutes before rear window is fitted to rear window
aperture.

Waiting time of 1 hour
is necessary before any further work is carried out on rear
window.

Vehicle must be
allowed to stand for recommended period of time
notes:
Use Oscillating Knife MKM-846-1P in
conjunction with Blade MKM-846-3 
 Cut out rear
window from engine side.
